User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the system, regardless of their role.

authenticationUid.description: Unique identifier provided by the authentication system.

profileImageUrl.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

faceProfileImageUrls.description: URLs of the user's enrolled face profile photos for verification.

alternateEmail.description: An alternate email address for the user.

enrollmentNumber.description: The user's unique student enrollment number.

branch.description: The academic branch or department (e.g., Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering).

currentYear.description: The user's current year of study.

admissionDate.description: The date the user was admitted.

admissionCategory.description: The category under which the user was admitted (e.g., General, Reserved, Management Quota).

fatherName.description: The name of the user's father.

fatherOccupation.description: The occupation of the user's father.

motherName.description: The name of the user's mother.

motherOccupation.description: The occupation of the user's mother.

collegeIdCardUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded college ID card.

casteCertificateUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded caste certificate.

casteValidityUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded caste validity certificate.

capOrManagementCertificateUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded CAP or management certificate.

pwdCertificateUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded PWD certificate.

panCardUrl.description: URL of the user's uploaded PAN card.

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student in the system, extending the User entity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

Teacher.title: Teacher
Teacher.description: Represents a teacher in the system, extending the User entity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Teacher entity.

AttendanceSession.title: AttendanceSession
AttendanceSession.description: Represents a single attendance session (e.g., a lecture).

teacherId.description: Reference to Teacher who created the session.

title.description: The title or subject of the attendance session.

startTime.description: The start time of the attendance session.

endTime.description: The end time of the attendance session.

presentStudentIds.description: Array of student UIDs who were marked present in this session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Quiz entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to Teacher who created the quiz.

branch.description: The academic branch for which this quiz is intended.

currentYear.description: The year of study for which this quiz is intended.

duration.description: Duration of the quiz in minutes.

QuizQuestion.title: QuizQuestion
QuizQuestion.description: Represents a question within a quiz.

id.description: Unique identifier for the QuizQuestion entity.

questionText.description: The text of the quiz question.

QuizAttempt.title: QuizAttempt
QuizAttempt.description: Represents a student's attempt at a quiz.

id.description: Unique identifier for the QuizAttempt entity.

studentAnswers.description: The student's answers to the quiz questions.

tabSwitchCount.description: The number of times the student switched tabs during the quiz.

autoSubmissionFlag.description: Flag indicating whether the quiz was auto-submitted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Assignment entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to Teacher who created the assignment.

branch.description: The academic branch for which this assignment is intended.

currentYear.description: The year of study for which this assignment is intended.

fileUrl.description: A URL to the assignment file (e.g., PDF, DOCX).

AssignmentSubmission.title: AssignmentSubmission
AssignmentSubmission.description: Represents a student's submission for an assignment.

teacherId.description: Denormalized reference to the Teacher who created the assignment.

studentName.description: The name of the student who submitted the assignment.

submissionFileUrl.description: The URL of the submitted file in Firebase Storage.

evaluationStatus.description: The evaluation status of the submission.

marks.description: Marks awarded by the teacher, out of 10. Null until evaluated.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Represents an academic resource shared by a teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Resource entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to Teacher who uploaded the resource.

subject.description: The subject to which the resource is mapped.

branch.description: The academic branch for which the resource is intended.

currentYear.description: The year of study for which the resource is intended.

fileUrl.description: A reference to the file (e.g., URL in Firebase Storage).

studentName.description: Denormalized student name for teacher view.

examType.description: The type of exam (e.g., regular, backlog).

subjectsSelected.description: The subjects selected for the exam.

feeReceiptUrl.description: URL of the uploaded fee receipt.

approvalStatus.description: The approval status of the exam form.

HallTicket.title: HallTicket
HallTicket.description: Represents a student's hall ticket for an exam, uploaded by a teacher.

Result.title: Result
Result.description: Represents a student's result for a specific exam.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Result entity.

semester.description: The semester for which the result is recorded.

examType.description: The type of exam (e.g., regular, backlog).

GradeCard.title: GradeCard
GradeCard.description: Represents a consolidated grade card for a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GradeCard entity.

downloadableDocumentUrl.description: URL for downloading the grade card document.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification sent to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Notification entity.

LessonPlan.title: LessonPlan
LessonPlan.description: Represents a lesson plan uploaded by a teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the LessonPlan entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to Teacher who created the lesson plan.

teacherName.description: Denormalized name of the teacher who uploaded the plan.

subject.description: The subject of the lesson plan.

title.description: The title of the lesson plan.

description.description: The description of the lesson plan.

branch.description: The academic branch for which this lesson plan is intended.

currentYear.description: The year of study for which this lesson plan is intended.

fileUrl.description: A URL to the lesson plan file (e.g., PDF, DOCX).

Feedback.title: Feedback
Feedback.description: Represents anonymous feedback submitted by a student for a subject, based on a set of questions.

studentId.description: Reference to the Student who submitted the feedback (for security rules).

teacherId.description: Reference to the Teacher who teaches the subject.

teacherName.description: Denormalized name of the teacher for display.

subject.description: The subject for which the feedback is given.

questionAnswers.description: An array of questions and the student's corresponding answers.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the feedback was submitted.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the Academic Management Platform with Continuous AI-Based Attendance, adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). Authorization independence is achieved through denormalization. For instance, access to `attendanceIntervals` is determined by denormalized data about the `AttendanceSession` and `Student`.  Specifically, any authorization-relevant data about the `AttendanceSession` (e.g., associated teacher) would be copied into the `attendanceIntervals` documents. This avoids the need for `get()` calls in security rules. To support QAPs, data segregation is employed. Public resources are stored separately from private student data. Membership maps aren't explicitly used here because the ownership model is primarily path-based (e.g., `/users/{userId}/results/{resultId}`), and roles are stored directly in the `users` collection.
